text: 5/ But none of these companies relied on ongoing private mkts to fund their expansion or search for profitability.  They found it early on.
4/ $AMZN is another example who takes it to the extreme.  Sinks every profit dollar into expanding their moat.
3/ These companies gush money into all kinds of things.  But their core business was profitable early on and could feed these other bets.
2/ The idea that the path to a massive outcome is massive losses before massive profits is misguided.  People are making up history.
$MSFT IPO in 1986. Profitable since 1982. $GOOG IPO in 2004. Profitable since 2001. $FB IPO in 2012. Profitable since 2009.  Trend anyone?
